name: TownePlace Suites Scranton Wilkes-Barre

reviews.text: My family of 4 stayed in the hotel in December, just before Christmas time.It is well maintained, nice exterior and interior, clean. I did not use the gym, but pool and hot tub were very nice. In the room all in working condition, enough of pots, good dishwasher, clean kitchen area and shelves, clean fridge, a very nice bathroom with spacious closet. I liked the area very much- it is very close to the mountain, to the park with kids' playgrounds and shopping area. Some details I'd like to share:
reviews.title: Nice place, Beautiful mountain view, some Housekeeping issue

reviews.text: 1. Photos on the website Do NOt reflect the reality. I stayed in a King Studio and it is NOT specious at all. I barelly squeezed with two toddlers. When the sofabed is opened it is so close to a King bed that there is no walking space in between two. And the room is listed up to 4 people (assuming the adults). There is only ONE chair , no eating area, and actually no sitting area. This room is no more than for 2+ (family of three with the baby or toddler).
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: 2. Housekeepping and its schedule. One day when we came back at 1:05PM our room was not yet cleaned. I asked to clean it ASAP because with two toddlers I needed it clean before lunch and before my kids would be taking a nap, which is right after lunch. After sitting in a lobby for 25 min. no one even started working in the room. So I had to remind it again. After being in the lobby for a total of 1hr. 15 min I was able to come to my room. I asked management not to overlook this issue for the rest of my staying. So the next morning they decided to make cleaning at 9:20AM when I was in the shower. Imagine my surprise when I stepped out from the shower all wet and saw a housekeeping lady in my room.
reviews.title: Close but no cigar

reviews.text: We are from the Poconos and stayed here during the aftermath of Hurricane Sandy. We lost power during the Storm and with all the damage to the power lines we knew we would not have Power for a long time. We called about 40 hotels in the Poconos, Allentown and Bethlehem area but none of them had rooms available and if they did there were no pets allowed. We were disappointed and all about to give up when we decided that the call to TownePlace Suites would be our last one. To our surprise a very pleasant voice greeted us from reservations and let us know that there were rooms available and that pets were allowed. We immediately reserved our room and drove an hour to the hotel. The hotel has excellent facilities. The rooms are Great with kitchenettes that have stainless steel appliances and granite counter tops.
reviews.title: Great midpriced hotel for families or long term stays.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While we were checking in we also learned that all Hotel rooms of the Marriott Group of hotels are non-smoking. We would like to applaud and thank the Marriott Group for this.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay in Scranton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room here had a good-quality king-sized bed, a couch, small kitchenette and desk. It was nicely decorated in warm colors. The front desk staff was friendly and efficient. Breakfast is included in the room rate, and it is the usual stuff - bagels, microwavable egg sandwiches, etc. The coffee was better than average (i.e., not weak).
reviews.title: New, comfortable, convenient

reviews.text: The hotel sits on the mountain, near the Montage Mountain Resort. It is new, modern & clean. The rooms are great for families, as they have a full kitchen. The breakfast was better than expected, and they had many choices besides the standard cereal, bagel, toast & fruit; they also had waffles, a sausage and egg sandwich on an English muffin & a bacon, egg & cheese sandwich in a croissant. They have a nice area outside with a firepit to sit around also. There were many restaurants and stores closeby. We will be going back!
reviews.title: Wow-great hotel, beautiful setting!

reviews.text: I stay here often and it is consistently good. I don't use all the facilities but appreciate knowing they are available. I would bring my family here. The staff is nice. The location is close by a couple of nice restaurant and a panera and Starbucks.
reviews.title: All round good choice hotel...

reviews.text: We were returning home and looking for a place to stay overnight.
reviews.title: Good Rest

reviews.text: This hotel was more than adequate in that it was roomy for the two of us and quiet and comfortable.
reviews.title: Home Away from Home

reviews.text: After staying at another local Marriott, I decided to try this hotel. Great idea! I have been staying in a King studio. It is a little smaller than similar rooms I have stayed at in other hotels. It might be a little cramped for more than two people. Lots of cabinets to store your stuff, a small closet just inside the entry, a bigger closet in the bathroom, refrigerator, dishwasher, microwave, and two burners for cooking. There isn't a kitchen table and chairs, but there is a table with wheels that fits under the desk. I love this because you can put it anywhere you want for eating or your computer. Furniture is comfortable, though the bed is a little firm for my taste. I travel for work so when I go somewhere I'm there for 10 to 11 days. One of the best things for me is that housekeeping does a full clean of the room midway throught my stay. I have never stayed at any other hotel that provides that service.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: Staff is friendly & very helpful. Nice flagstone patio with chairs & fire pit at front of the hotel. Not great, but okay breakfast. I haven't used the pool or exercise room. Easy on/off from I-81. A few restaurants & movie plex close by.
reviews.title: Nice and clean, good value

reviews.text: Rooms are nice. Not huge, but decent. Nice staff. The breakfast is terrible. The hotel suggested ordering food from the "Gourmet Slice." Take my advice: don't. In an area known fro pizza and wings, this place is not even worth one star. It was the only bad thing to come from our stay.
reviews.title: Good family place

reviews.text: We stayed here in two rooms with kids for a birthday party. Kids had so much fun in the pool. This is a newer property and it shows. Close to shopping, baseball (Will open next year), movie plex, and a few good restaurants (drive). We brought the portable DVD player and hooked up fine to the TV and kids had entertainment. Beds were comfortable, Breakfast was basic. Close to Ski/swim, casino is a 20 min drive.
reviews.title: Rooms not designed with families in mind.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Newer hotel in a convenient location off I-81. Part of a Marriott complex with multiple hotels brands nearby (Comfort Inn, Spring Hill Suites, etc.). Staff were friendly and building was clean. A buffet breakfast was included featuring mostly cold foods like yogurt and bananas but also some breakfast sandwiches that were okay. Our main complaint was the design of the guest room. We are a family of four and reserved a room with a king bed and sofa bed for the kids. We arrived late and were disappointed that we had to make up the bed ourselves. In addition, the room was set up so that when the sofa bed was pulled out it divided the room in half with no space to walk between the king bed and sofa bed. A few other odd design choices: main closet in the bathroom rather than near the entryway, waste basket in a cupboard under the bathroom sink (so took us a minute to find), small square pillows for the bed instead of standard size pillows, smaller TV situated parallel to the bed (although you could swivel for viewing). A lot of space wasted on a large desk with a hutch that seems like it would never be used unless someone set up an office there and brought all of their books and binders along. There was a kitchenette in the entryway with a small stove, microwave and a large dishwasher that could be useful for someone. Overall the hotel was fine for a solo business traveler, but for our family a room with two double beds and a little more space would have made more sense.
reviews.title: Great pet-friendly hotel, Fabulous staff!

reviews.text: OK - first the good - the Towne Place Suites hotel is fairly new, clean and seems well run. It is conveniently located at the Montage Mountain, area but I would NOT say the base of Montage mountain as that term is a misnomer, get to that later!
reviews.title: Nice place but smaller than expected.

reviews.text: My compliaint is that compared to Residence Inns that we usually stay at, the place is a little small, even for us as a family of three and not physically large either. We booked a 2 room suite and were quite pleased but the living area was small along with the bedrooms. Usually in a Residence Inn there are 2 bathrooms in a 2 bedroom unit and the one bathroom was..you guessed it...small. The pool...right nice but small.
reviews.title: TownPlace in Moosic/Scranton

reviews.text: The breakfast bar was also a little skimpy, I was expected usually freshed scrambled eggs maybe some fresh fruit but none to be had. Just microwaveable breakfast sandwiches, waffle maker with bread, prepackaged yogurt and cereals. Not bad, but again I was expecting a little more.
reviews.title: A Lot Smaller Than I Expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I do not think they had any in-room movies to rent either.
reviews.title: Pet Friendly
New and Nice
reviews.text: Getting back to the location - it was convenient to all the shopping and restuarants but looking at the ski area from hotel, it seems like you could almost walk to it, but as I found out, you have to drive back down the hill to Montage Mt Road and then take about a 10 minute ride up and around the side of the mountain. Now the area was closed for the season but that is something to keep in mind for next ski season. I am not sure if the hotel operates a shuttle to the ski area but that would seem like good idea.

aka: Towneplace Suites Scranton Wilkes-Barre Hotel Moosic
